{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tafenoquine is an antimalarial drug. It is not used for prophylaxis of malaria in pregnancy due to potential harm to the fetus. It is also not used for treatment of severe falciparum malaria or endemic malaria in children under 2 years. However, it is used for the radical cure of Plasmodium vivax, which means it can kill both the blood stages and dormant liver stages of the parasite.", "answer_choice": "A"}
